@TamasBlummer Thanks for sharing.   With supply I mean flow, production, increase in monetary base (new coins), not existing coins (stock) changing hands. Bitcoin supply is fixed / inelastic, Gold supply is elastic and reacts to price. This difference is often overlooked when talking futures.

Real reasons Bitcoin won't experience traditional "financialization":  a) consequences of rehypothecation are extremely punitive; b) near frictionless storage & permissionless global transfer; c) clearing/settlement extends beyond regulated exchanges, so less centralised.

@100trillionUSD The analogy to silver and gold does not exactly translate.   There are lots of cash exchanges where #bitcoin is traded. So unlike silver or gold which has the London gold fix, #bitcoin is traded globally on exchanges where physical #bitcoin can be purchased and removed.
